page.title: 05The Parish Church part 2
page.content: The parish registers have been kept regularly since about 1559 and it is interesting to note some of the names so well known in our village today :_ Thurgood,Page,Mott,Pickett and Knight. In 1641 the church was raided by George Thurgood to destroy the coloured figures in the stained glass windows. This raid was instigated by the Puritan John Skringle. The communion rails were also destroyed and the church plate and bells were stolen. Finally the church walls were whitewashed. In the second half of the 17th century we find records of people being "buried in woollin", this made compulsory by Act of Parliament in 1666 to help the wool trade. Any departure from this incurred a fine of Â£5.
